TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP citizen , born in DATE and living in GPE , GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent Ms Lidija PERSON
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant was born in GPE , at that time part of ORG ( hereinafter “ SFRY ” ) , where he had lived until DATE when , together with his family , he allegedly left for GPE . As he did not obtain permission to stay in GPE , in DATE he moved to GPE . DATE he returned to GPE and lived in different parts of the then occupied territories .

In DATE ORG passed a law governing temporary use of the property of persons who left GPE - Temporary Takeover and Managing of LAW ( Zakon o privremenom preuzimanju i upravljanju određenom imovinom - hereinafter the “ LAW ” ) , which allowed municipalities to give such property for the use of other persons .
It appears that , pursuant to that LAW , the GPE temporarily accommodated PERSON in the applicant ’s house in NORP .
On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings with ORG seeking re - possession of his house .
On DATE the court pronounced judgment by default in the applicant ’s favour .

Subsequently , PERSON filed an application to return the proceedings to the status quo ante and at the same time lodged an appeal against the judgment . On DATE ORG dismissed the application to return the proceedings to the status quo ante .

In DATE ORG adopted the Programme for ORG povratka i zbrinjavanja prognanika , izbjeglica i raseljenih osoba - hereinafter the “ Programme for Return ” ) , regulating the principles for their return and the re - possession of their property .
In DATE ORG passed LAW of LAW ( Zakon o prestanku važenja PERSON o privremenom preuzimanju i upravljanu određenom imovinom ) .

The applicant sought , and on DATE obtained , an eviction order from ORG . The eviction with the assistance of the court organs was scheduled for DATE , but was not enforced due to PERSON above mentioned appeal against the judgment by default of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE the ORG quashed the first instance judgment , and remitted the case to ORG for re - examination . It found that ORG had failed to assess whether PERSON was given a permission to use the applicant ’s property according to LAW , or without any legal basis , as that was a decisive fact concerning the application of ORG .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim . It found that the applicant wrongly filed his action with a municipal court . Instead , he should have filed a request for re - possession of his property with a housing commission , as provided by LAW of LAW . The court also stated that that LAW was a lex specialis in relation to LAW ( Zakon o vlasništvu i drugim stvarnim pravima ) , which regulates property rights . As neither party appealed against that decision , it became final on DATE .

According to the documents submitted by the applicant , it appears that in the meantime he had lodged a request for re - possession of his property with ORG ( PERSON ) . On DATE ORG decided to annul the previous decision by which PERSON had obtained the right of use of the applicant ’s property .
Subsequently , upon PERSON appeal , on DATE ORG upheld its previous decision . It found that PERSON was the illegal possessor of the applicant ’s property .
On DATE ORG ordered PERSON to vacate the LOC within DATE . It appears that he failed to comply with that order .
On DATE ORG filed an action for eviction of PERSON from the applicant ’s property with ORG . It appears that these proceedings are currently pending .

Section CARDINAL § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Act on Termination of the Temporary Takeover and ORG ( Official Gazette no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) provide that the proceedings concerning temporary use , management and control of the property of persons who left GPE are to be conducted by the housing commissions in the first instance and by the municipal courts in the second instance . They shall apply provisions of LAW .
Section CARDINAL of the Programme of Return of Refugees and Displaced Persons ( Official Gazette no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) provide as follows :

“ Persons with NORP documents , who are the owners of property in GPE where other persons are temporarily accommodated , may apply to the municipal housing commissions and seek re - possession of their property . The commission shall inform the owner within DATE about the status of his property . Relying on the proof of the ownership , the commission shall annul previous decision allowing temporary accommodation of other persons and order the persons accommodated to vacate the LOC . The commission shall serve a written decision to the owner and the temporary occupier within DATE . The decision shall contain a time limit for eviction and an offer of an alternative lodging for a temporary occupier in a house or a flat in the state ownership .

“ In case that a temporary occupier does not vacate the premises within the fixed time , the commission shall institute eviction proceedings with a competent municipal court within DATE . The court shall apply provisions concerning the civil summary proceedings . The court ’s decision is immediately enforceable . An appeal does not interfere with the enforcement proceedings or the re - possession of the property by the owner . "
